net.unicon.cas.addons.serviceregistry.mongodb

Class MongoServiceRegistryDao

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.unicon.cas.addons.serviceregistry.mongodb.MongoServiceRegistryDao
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jasig.cas.services.ServiceRegistryDao, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

    @Repository
public final class MongoServiceRegistryDao
extends Object
implements org.jasig.cas.services.ServiceRegistryDao, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
    Implementation of ServiceRegistryDao that uses a MongoDb repository as the backend persistence mechanism. The repository is configured by the Spring application context.

    The class will automatically create a default collection to use with services. The name of the collection may be specified through setCollectionName(String). It also presents the ability to drop an existing collection and start afresh through the use of setDropCollection(boolean).

    Since:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Misagh Moayyed, Unicon, inc.

      • setCollectionName

        public void setCollectionName(String name)
        Optionally, specify the name of the mongodb collection where services are to be kept. By default, the name of the collection is specified by the constant MONGODB_COLLECTION_NAME

      • setDropCollection

        public void setDropCollection(boolean dropCollection)
        When set to true, the collection will be dropped first before proceeding with other operations.
